pages.text: $(l:materials/Manganese)Manganese$(/l)(IV) oxide is the inorganic compound with the formula MnO2. This blackish or brown solid occurs naturally as the mineral pyrolusite, which is the main ore of $(l:materials/Manganese)manganese$(/l) and a component of $(l:materials/Manganese)manganese$(/l) nodules. The principal use for MnO2 is for dry-cell batteries, such as the alkaline battery and the $(l:materials/Zinc)zinc$(/l)-$(l:materials/Carbon)carbon$(/l) battery. MnO2 is also used as a pigment and as a precursor to other $(l:materials/Manganese)manganese$(/l) compounds, such as KMnO4. It

is used as a reagent in organic synthesis, for example, for the oxidation of allylic alcohols. MnO2 in the Î± polymorph can incorporate a variety of atoms (as well as water molecules) in the "tunnels" or "channels" between the $(l:materials/Manganese)manganese$(/l) oxide octahedra. There is considerable interest in alpha-MnO2 as a possible cathode for $(l:materials/Lithium)lithium$(/l) ion batteries.
